newsitem.title: JAPAN: Tokyo corn futures end mixed after earlier losses.
newsitem.headline: Tokyo corn futures end mixed after earlier losses.

text.p: Tokyo corn futures closed mixed on Monday after the yen's fall against the dollar pushed up some contracts, traders said.
Prices ranged from 270 yen lower to 160 yen higher, with benchmark November down 150 yen at 14,700 yen per tonne. Daily volume was 57,829 lots.

Bearish sentiment dominated the Tokyo market during the morning sessions as individual investors rushed to sell, traders said. "Investors still remember the price plunges last week. They are quick to liquidate long positions on any bearish factor," a brokerage house trader said.
But some months recovered by late afternoon, reflecting the yen's weakening against the dollar, the traders said.
The spot December contract on the CBOT Project A trading system was being traded at $2.80 per bushel at 0810 GMT, compared with $2.80-1/4 on Friday.
The spot November CBOT soybean futures contract was at $6.81 at 0810 GMT, against $6.82 at Friday's close.
